titleStmt.title: R. B. McCall et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7143

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlett Governor of Kentucky the undersigned petitoners citizens of Boyd County Kentucky would respectfully represent that at the October term of the Boyd circuit Court 1865 there was a judgment of the Boyd circuit Court rendered against Robert Eastham for the sum of Three Hundred dollars in forfeited recognizance as security of Robert Christy Your petitioners would further represent that Robert Eastham went said security as they believe in good faith beleiving said Christy innocent and he had no doubt he would appear at Court, he failed to do so Eastham is a good citizen, living law and order and is no friend to the guilty he was innocently decoyed into this suretyship and we pray your Excellency to remitt the forfeiture against him, or so much as can be done under the Law and will ever pray

R B McCall, M, J, C
H. B Brodess Judge B C
A Bagley.
Police Judge of Ashland
Laban T Moore
J, D, Jones County atty
W. A. Hampton clk. B. C. C.
Peter Cooly Jailor
Thomas. J Berry J P B C

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
Robert Eastham
$300,
Forfeiture
Remitted 31st Oct /65
